rows.description: All splice junctions from all 803 GTEx v3 muscle samples. The junction-spanning read counts and read coverage are summed across all samples.
rows.name: GTEx Muscle

rows.description: All splice junctions from all 755 GTEx v3 blood samples. The junction-spanning read counts and read coverage are summed across all samples.
rows.name: GTEx Blood

rows.description: All splice junctions from all 504 GTEx v3 fibroblast samples. The junction-spanning read counts and read coverage are summed across all samples.
rows.name: GTEx Fibs

rows.description:
All splice junctions from all 174 GTEx v3 lymphocyte samples.
The junction-spanning read counts and read coverage are summed across all samples.
rows.name: GTEx Lymph

rows.description:
All splice junctions from all 255 GTEx v3 cortex samples.
The junction-spanning read counts and read coverage are summed across all samples.
rows.name: GTEx Brain: Cortex

rows.description:
All splice junctions from all 209 GTEx v3 frontal cortex samples.
The junction-spanning read counts and read coverage are summed across all samples.
rows.name: GTEx Brain: Front. Cortex

rows.description:
Highly expressed junctions from all 803 GTEx v3 muscle samples.
The junction-spanning read counts are normalized to represent the average spanning read count per-sample (see formula below). Only junctions with rounded normalized spanning read count > 0 are included in this track.

average_unique_reads_per_muscle_sample = (total_unqiue_reads_in_all_muscle_samples / number_of_muscle_samples)
per_sample_normalized_read_count = raw_read_count * average_unique_reads_per_muscle_sample / total_unqiue_reads_in_this_sample
normalized read count for junction = sum(per_sample_normalized_read_counts) / number_of_muscle_samples
rows.name: Norm. GTEx Muscle

Highly expressed junctions from all 755 GTEx v3 blood samples.
The junction-spanning read counts are normalized to represent the average spanning read count per-sample (see formula below). Only junctions with rounded normalized spanning read count > 0 are included in this track.

per_sample_normalized_read_count = raw_read_count * average_unique_reads_per_blood_sample / total_unqiue_reads_in_this_sample
normalized read count for junction = sum(per_sample_normalized_read_counts) / number_of_blood_samples

average_unique_reads_per_cortex_sample = (total_unqiue_reads_in_all_cortex_samples / number_of_cortex_samples)

average_unique_reads_per_cortex_sample = (total_unqiue_reads_in_all_cortex_samples / number_of_cortex_samples)

rows.description: Duplications of >1000 Bases of Non-RepeatMasked Sequence downloaded from UCSC
rows.name: SegDups >1000 bases

rows.description:
SpliceAI delta score visualization. This is generated from Illumina's precomputed scores for all possible
SNVs and small InDels within the exons and introns of GENCODE v24 canonical transcripts.
This track shows an arc for each variant that's predicted to disrupt splicing at another nearby position in the mRNA with a score >= 0.5
rows.name: SpliceAI gain (score >= 0.5)

rows.description:
SpliceAI delta score visualization. This is generated from Illumina's precomputed scores for all possible
SNVs and small InDels within the exons and introns of GENCODE v24 canonical transcripts.
This track shows an arc for each variant that's predicted to disrupt splicing at another nearby position in the mRNA with a score >= 0.5
rows.name: SpliceAI loss (score >= 0.5)

rows.description:
